item.title: AppStore prices
item.description:
Database size : 6,35 Go
Database records : 1,135,994 applications


1. Prices

Number of applications by price


Price Number of applications Pourcent
Free 780,767 69%
$0,99 168,168 15%
$1,99 72,108 6%
$2,99 43,983 4%
$3,99 16,611 1%
$4,99 21,677 2%
$5,99 4,766 0%
$6,99 3,136 0%
$7,99 2,145 0%
$8,99 1,508 0%
$9,99 8,473 1%
$10,99 911 0%
$11,99 663 0%
$12,99 617 0%


  • 70% of the AppStore applications are free.
  • 15% of the AppStore applications are $0,99.
  • 15% of the AppStore applications are > $0,99.

By looking at the prices graph we can find a peak for $9,99. Is it normal ? why ?
=> That’s a psychological price!

item.title: AppStore supported devices
item.description:
Database size : 6,35 Go
Database records : 1,135,994 applications

We have seen in the previous article that iOS supported version change with release date. What is the impact on the supported devices? I will not speak about compatibility or optimized version (optimized for iPhone 6 or not). This article is about application that can be installed on my devices. (remember i have old devices, i want to know if they will be able to install actual apps.)

1. iPhone / iPad / Universel


Number of applications by device category


2. Supported iPhones


Number of applications availables by iPhone

Bad news !
Since December, 2012 we can considered that there is no new app or updates that can supports the 1st generation iPhone. Some months later (April, 2013) iPhone 3G can be qualitifer has an usupported device too.

3. Supported iPad


Number of applications availables by iPad

Good news!
iPad first generation is still supported. The minimal targeted iOS should be is 5.1.1. it’s a big effort for the development. (Support iOS version). The iPad 2 is a real survivor ! Out of the box in March 2011 and still actualy supported !

item.title: AppStore miminal iOS supported version
item.description:
Database size : 6,35 Go
Database records : 1,135,994 applications

The App Store opened on July 10, 2008. How many compatible applications can by find on the Appstore today for your “old” device.

1. Understanding iOS compatibility on the AppStore


Device limited iOS version
iPhone iOS 3.1.3
iPhone 3G iOS 4.1.2
iPhone 3GS iOS 6.1.6
iPhone 4 iOS 7.1.2
iPhone 4S + others iOS 8.X
iPad iOS 5.1.1
iPad 2 + others iOS 8.X


Source : iOS Matrix

2. iOS version compatibility on the AppStore

Pourcent of AppStore applications by iOS minimum version


iOS Number of applications Pourcent
iOS2 18,247 2%
iOS3 130,349 12%
iOS4 277,334 25%
iOS5 263,517 24%
iOS6 266,598 24%
iOS7 154,222 14%
iOS8 10,536 1%


It’s a good suprise. My iPhone 2G is compatible with 148,596 applications. My iPad1 is compatible with 689,447 apps.


3. Evolution of iOS support on the AppStore


Yes, i’m an iOS developer. Every day i have to choose the iOS minimal version to support. The next study is about the ‘1st release date’ of the application and the iOS minimum supported version.

3.1. One by one

iOS2 f(1st release date)
iOS3 f(1st release date)

key dates

February 16, 2012 : Xcode 4 (Minimal version 4.3)

October, 2012 : Xcode 4 become mandatory

iOS4 f(1st release date)

key dates

February 1, 2014 : Xcode 5 (Minimal version 4.3)

September 2014 : Xcode 5 become mandatory

iOS5 f(1st release date)
iOS6 f(1st release date)
iOS7 f(1st release date)
iOS8 f(1st release date)



The supported iOS is changing (it’s not very surprising). More recent released applications supports more recent iOS versions. It’s quite normal. Apple “controls” the supported version of iOS by the configuration of the minimal target version of Xcode.

  • Xcode 3 : Supports minimum target version iOS3.0
  • Xcode 4 : Supports minimum target version iOS4.3
  • Xcode 5 : Supports minimum target version iOS4.3
  • Xcode 6 : Supports minimum target version iOS4.3

Actually, it’s possible to do a iOS application with iOS4.3 compatibility but it’s complicated for developpers.


3.2. Cumulated

Cumulated iOS version f(1st release date)


Release date iOS4 iOS5 iOS6 iOS7 iOS8
September 2014 9,19% 16,73% 42,60% 29,28% 2,16%
January 2015 7,22% (-1,97%) 14,67% (-2,06%) 40,14% -2,46% 31,00% (+1,72%) 6,98% (+4,82%)


  • iOS4 : This old version is slowly abandoned. iOS4 is not very interesting iOS version to support. This version was released on june 2010 and the only impacted device is the iPhone 3G.
  • iOS5 : This major impact to support this version is to be able to deploy the applicaiton on the first iPad.
  • iOS6/7/8 : Are supported from iPhone 3GS to iPhone 6 Plus.


4. Why supporting iOS version is complicated ?


Problems iOS4 iOS5 iOS6 iOS7 iOS8
Environment : find a device is complicated x x x    
Environment : Xcode simulator missing x x x    
Code limitation : childViewController missing x x      
Code limitation : autolayout missing x x      
Code limitation : weak missing (less stability) x        
Code limitation : storyboard missing x        
Code limitation : CollectionView missing x x
